greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to 1 +- 4 +- 9 +- ... +- n^2 == 0 mod n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3334 (terms 1..1000 from Alois P. Heinz)
maple: b:= proc(n, i, m) option remember; `if`(i=0, `if`(n=0, 1, 0),
add(b(irem(n+j, m), i-1, m), j=[i^2, m-i^2]))
program: (PARI) a(n) = my (v=vector(n,k,k==1)); for (i=2, n, v = vector(n, k, v[1 + (k-i^2)%n] + v[1 + (k+i^2)%n])); v[1] \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Mar 01 2018
xref: Number of solutions to 1 +- 2^k +- 3^k +- ... +- n^k == 0 mod n: A300190 (k=1), this sequence (k=2), A300269 (k=3).
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 01 2018
